trans-unit.source: Update Job Properties
trans-unit.target: Update Job Properties

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Update Job Properties</languageKeyword> operation updates specific properties of a job.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Update Job Properties</languageKeyword> operation updates specific properties of a job.

trans-unit.source: You can call this operation to notify the Import/Export service that the hard drives comprising the import or export job have been shipped to the Microsoft data center.
trans-unit.target: You can call this operation to notify the Import/Export service that the hard drives comprising the import or export job have been shipped to the Microsoft data center.

trans-unit.source: An <languageKeyword>Update Job Properties</languageKeyword> request can also be used to cancel an existing job.
trans-unit.target: An <languageKeyword>Update Job Properties</languageKeyword> request can also be used to cancel an existing job.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Update Job Properties</languageKeyword> request may be constructed as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Update Job Properties</languageKeyword> request may be constructed as follows.

trans-unit.source: HTTPS is required.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS is required.

trans-unit.source: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with your subscription ID, <codeInline>%%amp;lt;storage-account-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of your storage account, and <codeInline>%%amp;lt;jobname%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of your job:
trans-unit.target: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with your subscription ID, <codeInline>%%amp;lt;storage-account-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of your storage account, and <codeInline>%%amp;lt;jobname%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of your job:

trans-unit.source: Sample Request and Response
trans-unit.target: Sample Request and Response

trans-unit.source: The following shows a sample request and response for the <languageKeyword>Update Job Properties</languageKeyword> operation.
trans-unit.target: The following shows a sample request and response for the <languageKeyword>Update Job Properties</languageKeyword> operation.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Update Job Properties</languageKeyword> operation enables you to update properties of a job after the job has been created.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Update Job Properties</languageKeyword> operation enables you to update properties of a job after the job has been created.

trans-unit.source: After you ship your drives to a Windows Azure data center, you are required to update certain fields before your job can be processed.
trans-unit.target: After you ship your drives to a Windows Azure data center, you are required to update certain fields before your job can be processed.

trans-unit.source: Some properties, like the <languageKeyword>Metadata</languageKeyword> property, may be updated at any time during the lifetime of a job, whereas the <languageKeyword>DeliveryPackage</languageKeyword> property can only be updated prior to the package's arrival at the Windows Azure data center.
trans-unit.target: Some properties, like the <languageKeyword>Metadata</languageKeyword> property, may be updated at any time during the lifetime of a job, whereas the <languageKeyword>DeliveryPackage</languageKeyword> property can only be updated prior to the package's arrival at the Windows Azure data center.

trans-unit.source: The table below describes when various properties can be changed.
trans-unit.target: The table below describes when various properties can be changed.

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Comments
trans-unit.target: Comments

trans-unit.source: May be updated at any time.
trans-unit.target: May be updated at any time.

trans-unit.source: May be updated at any time.
trans-unit.target: May be updated at any time.

trans-unit.source: May be updated at any time.
trans-unit.target: May be updated at any time.

trans-unit.source: May only be updated when the status of the job is <languageKeyword>Creating</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: May only be updated when the status of the job is <languageKeyword>Creating</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: May be updated when the status of the job is <languageKeyword>Creating</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>Shipping</languageKeyword>, or <languageKeyword>Transferring</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: May be updated when the status of the job is <languageKeyword>Creating</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>Shipping</languageKeyword>, or <languageKeyword>Transferring</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: May be updated until the status of the job is <languageKeyword>Packaging</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: May be updated until the status of the job is <languageKeyword>Packaging</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: May be updated until the status of the job is <languageKeyword>Packaging</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: May be updated until the status of the job is <languageKeyword>Packaging</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: May be updated until all drives arrive at the datacenter.
trans-unit.target: May be updated until all drives arrive at the datacenter.

trans-unit.source: May be updated until the status of the job is <languageKeyword>Packaging</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: May be updated until the status of the job is <languageKeyword>Packaging</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: May be updated until the status of the job is <languageKeyword>Packaging</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: May be updated until the status of the job is <languageKeyword>Packaging</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: May be updated until the status of the job is <languageKeyword>Transferring</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: May be updated until the status of the job is <languageKeyword>Transferring</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: You can call <languageKeyword>Update Job Properties</languageKeyword> to update your shipping information, or to cancel a job.
trans-unit.target: You can call <languageKeyword>Update Job Properties</languageKeyword> to update your shipping information, or to cancel a job.

trans-unit.source: These two functions are described in detail below.
trans-unit.target: These two functions are described in detail below.

trans-unit.source: Shipping
trans-unit.target: Shipping

trans-unit.source: After you ship your drives, you must call <languageKeyword>Update Job Properties</languageKeyword> with the <languageKeyword>State</languageKeyword> property set to <languageKeyword>Shipping</languageKeyword>, and with the <languageKeyword>ReturnAddress</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>DeliveryPackage</languageKeyword> properties set to valid values.
trans-unit.target: After you ship your drives, you must call <languageKeyword>Update Job Properties</languageKeyword> with the <languageKeyword>State</languageKeyword> property set to <languageKeyword>Shipping</languageKeyword>, and with the <languageKeyword>ReturnAddress</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>DeliveryPackage</languageKeyword> properties set to valid values.

trans-unit.source: In this way you notify the Import/Export service that your drives have been shipped.
trans-unit.target: In this way you notify the Import/Export service that your drives have been shipped.

trans-unit.source: Failure to set these properties or to notify the Import/Export service that the drives have shipped may result in delays in processing your import or export job.
trans-unit.target: Failure to set these properties or to notify the Import/Export service that the drives have shipped may result in delays in processing your import or export job.

trans-unit.source: Cancellation
trans-unit.target: Cancellation

trans-unit.source: To cancel a job, you must call <languageKeyword>Update Job Properties</languageKeyword> and set the <languageKeyword>CancelRequested</languageKeyword> property to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: To cancel a job, you must call <languageKeyword>Update Job Properties</languageKeyword> and set the <languageKeyword>CancelRequested</languageKeyword> property to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: You can cancel a job if its state is <languageKeyword>Creating</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>Shipping</languageKeyword>, or <languageKeyword>Transferring, </languageKeyword>but not if the state is<languageKeyword> Packaging</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: You can cancel a job if its state is <languageKeyword>Creating</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>Shipping</languageKeyword>, or <languageKeyword>Transferring, </languageKeyword>but not if the state is<languageKeyword> Packaging</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: When you cancel a job, any drives that have not entered the data transfer process will be skipped.
trans-unit.target: When you cancel a job, any drives that have not entered the data transfer process will be skipped.

trans-unit.source: The job will be completed for any drives that are already in the data transfer process.
trans-unit.target: The job will be completed for any drives that are already in the data transfer process.

trans-unit.source: The Import/Export service cancels a job on a best effort basis, but there are no guarantees about the success of a cancellation request.
trans-unit.target: The Import/Export service cancels a job on a best effort basis, but there are no guarantees about the success of a cancellation request.

trans-unit.source: Conditional Headers
trans-unit.target: Conditional Headers

trans-unit.source: You can call <languageKeyword>Update Job Properties</languageKeyword> with conditional headers specified to update the job only when certain conditions are met.
trans-unit.target: You can call <languageKeyword>Update Job Properties</languageKeyword> with conditional headers specified to update the job only when certain conditions are met.

trans-unit.source: When specifying conditional headers, keep in mind the following:
trans-unit.target: When specifying conditional headers, keep in mind the following:

trans-unit.source: If a request specifies both the <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-Modified-Since</parameterReference> headers, the request is evaluated based on the criteria specified in <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: If a request specifies both the <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-Modified-Since</parameterReference> headers, the request is evaluated based on the criteria specified in <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: If a request specifies both the <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-Unmodified-Since</parameterReference> headers, the request is evaluated based on the criteria specified in <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: If a request specifies both the <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-Unmodified-Since</parameterReference> headers, the request is evaluated based on the criteria specified in <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: With the exception of the two combinations of conditional headers listed above, a request may specify only a single conditional header.
trans-unit.target: With the exception of the two combinations of conditional headers listed above, a request may specify only a single conditional header.

trans-unit.source: Specifying more than one conditional header results in status code 400 (<languageKeyword>Bad Request</languageKeyword>).
trans-unit.target: Specifying more than one conditional header results in status code 400 (<languageKeyword>Bad Request</languageKeyword>).

trans-unit.source: The following table indicates the response codes returned for an unmet condition for each conditional header:
trans-unit.target: The following table indicates the response codes returned for an unmet condition for each conditional header:

trans-unit.source: Conditional header
trans-unit.target: Conditional header

trans-unit.source: Response code if condition has not been met
trans-unit.target: Response code if condition has not been met

trans-unit.source: Precondition Failed (412)
trans-unit.target: Precondition Failed (412)

trans-unit.source: Precondition Failed (412)
trans-unit.target: Precondition Failed (412)

trans-unit.target: Precondition Failed (412)
